dji.sdk.api.Battery

Class DJIInspireBattery

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.Battery.DJIBattery
        • dji.sdk.api.Battery.DJIInspireBattery

  • public class DJIInspireBattery
extends DJIBattery

    DJI Inspire Battery Class

    As an extension of DJIBattery, DJIInspireBattery could specifically communicate with the Inspire 1 as well as Phantom 3 and share same properties with DJIBattery, which means it could receive current battery information and status from M100 Inspire 1 and Phantom 3.

    To make sure the information interchange is stable and completed, the lifecycle of callback should be set correctly. Effected by the android life cycle, the callback, especially the one receives the information from the aircraft, should follow the pattern of android system and update its statement on the basis of the stage of the life cycle. For better understanding the construction of the life cycle of DJI callback, we will provide a tutorial for setting up the callback life cycle. The code following is a sample of life cycle setting of DJIBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack.

    Private DJIBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack mBattryUpdateInfoCallBack = null;

    Protected void onCreate(Bundle saveInstanceState){
      // other statements
      mBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack = new DJIBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack(){
        public void onResult(DJIBatteryProperty state){
          public void run(){
        }
      }
    }

    Protected void onResume(){
      //other statements
      DJIDrone.getDjiBattery().startUpdateTimer(2000);
    }

    Protected void onResume(){
      //other statements
      DJIDrone.getDjiBattery().startUpdateTimer(2000);
    }

    Protected void onPause(){
      //other statements
      DJIDrone.getDjiBattery().stopUpdateTimer();
    }
    Version:
    : V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

    • Method Detail

      • getBatteryConnectionStatus

        public void getBatteryConnectionStatus(DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        This function will provide the connection status.
        Overrides:
        getBatteryConnectionStatus in class DJIBattery
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - - The callback will provide an object of DJIError which will contain the information about the command result. In addition, the result will provide the connection status. 0 - Normal, 1 - Invalid battery, 2 - communication exception

      • getBatteryErrorType

        public void getBatteryErrorType(DJIBatteryGetErrorTypeCallback mCallBack)
        This function will return the error type. The error type contains the information about the battery itself and the connection status.
        The relationships between integer and status are as follow:
        0x00000001 - first level current
        0x00000002 - second level current
        0x00000004 - first level over heat
        0x00000008 - second level over heat
        0x00000010 - first level low temp
        0x00000020 - second level low temp
        0x00000040 - short circuit
        0x00000380 - cell low voltage
        0x00001C00 - cell invalid
        0x0000E000 - cell replace
        0x00010000 - watch dog rest
        0x00020000 - discharge
        Overrides:
        getBatteryErrorType in class DJIBattery
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - DJIExecuteIntResultCallback will return the execution result of getting they type of error.
        onResult(int result) result is the error type code and mErr will return the status of

      • getBatteryHistoryStatus

        public void getBatteryHistoryStatus(DJIBatteryGetHistoryStatusCallBack mCallBack)
        This function will return the history status of the battery in last 31 times. The integers in the array means the battery statuses for last 31 times. The relationships between integer and status are as follow:
        0x00000001 - first level current
        0x00000002 - second level current
        0x00000004 - first level over heat
        0x00000008 - second level over heat
        0x00000010 - first level low temp
        0x00000020 - second level low temp
        0x00000040 - short circuit
        0x00000380 - cell low voltage
        0x00001C00 - cell invalid
        0x0000E000 - cell replace
        0x00010000 - watch dog rest
        0x00020000 - discharge
        Overrides:
        getBatteryHistoryStatus in class DJIBattery
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The callback is designed for getting battery history status information such as overheat or low temperature. All of this information will be presented in integer format and the relating list is present above.

        onResult(int[] batteryHistoryStatus) - the batteryHistoryStatus is the array of historical status record. the size of this array is 31.

      • getBatteryCurrentState

        public void getBatteryCurrentState(DJIBatteryGetCurrentStateCallBack mCallback)
        This function will return the current state of battery. If the function's requests fails, it will return a object of DJIBatteryState with the -1 damagedCellIndex.
        Parameters:
        mCallback - DJIBatteryGetCurrentStateCallBack will return the current state of battery.
        onResult(DJIBatteryState state) state is an object containing over heat, low temperature, low battery level and so on.
        See Also:
        DJIBatteryState

      • getBatterySelfDischargeDay

        public void getBatterySelfDischargeDay(DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get the battery self-discharge day.
        Overrides:
        getBatterySelfDischargeDay in class DJIBattery
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback will return the day of self-discharging

        onResult(double result, DJIError mErr) - result is the day of self-discharging and mErr will contains the request result, success or out-of-time.

      • setBatterySelfDischargeDay

        public void setBatterySelfDischargeDay(int days,
                                       DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        This function is used to set up the battery self-discharge day.
        Overrides:
        setBatterySelfDischargeDay in class DJIBattery
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback will return the day of self-discharging

        onResult(double result, DJIError mErr) - result is the day of self-discharging and mErr will contains the request result, success or out-of-time.
        days - it's the day how long the battery will discharge

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int interval)
        Set up the updating timer for receiving the instant information from the drone. This API will set up a timer for periodically invoking the DJIBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack, which could be set up by using setBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack.
        Please note that the interval could not be lower than 100ms.
        Overrides:
        startUpdateTimer in class DJIBattery
        Parameters:
        interval - Timer run interval
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.DJIBatteryProperty, setBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack(dji.sdk.interfaces.DJIBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack)

      • stopUpdateTimer

        public boolean stopUpdateTimer()
        Invoke this function, the updating timer will be shut down.
        Overrides:
        stopUpdateTimer in class DJIBattery
        Returns:
        true - success
        false - fail
